column2: They learned much about Britain; for trading vessels, even at that early day, crossed the Channel.
column3: They learned much about Britain; for trading vessels, even at that early day, crossed the Channel.

column2: After the Roman legions had left Britain, the Jutes, led, it is said, by two great captains named Hengist and Horsa, landed upon the southeastern coast and made a settlement.
column3: After the Roman legions had left Britain, the Jutes, led, it is said, by two great captains named Hengist and Horsa, landed upon the southeastern coast and made a settlement.

column2: Aid came to them in a singular way.
column3: Aid came to them in a singular way.

column2: He asked the dealer who they were.
column3: He asked the dealer who they were.

column2: Still, though both Angles and Saxons called themselves Christians, they were seldom at peace; and for more than two hundred years they frequently fought.
column3: Still, though both Angles and Saxons called themselves Christians, they were seldom at peace; and for more than two hundred years they frequently fought.

column2: Soon after this a welcome message came to Egbert.
column3: Soon after this a welcome message came to Egbert.

column2: The mind of the people in Wessex had changed and they had elected him king.
column3: The mind of the people in Wessex had changed and they had elected him king.
